quote: My advice to you is get married: If you find a good wife you’ll be happy; if not, you’ll become a philosopher.
author: Socrates

quote: If you want to be sure that you never forget your wife’s birthday, just try forgetting it once.
author: Aldo Cammarota

quote: Before you marry a person, you should first make them use a computer with slow Internet service to see who they really are.
author: Will Ferrell

quote: Never criticize your spouse’s faults; if it weren’t for them, your mate might have found someone better than you.
author: Jay Trachman

quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Instead of getting married again, I’m going to find a woman I don’t like and give her a house.
author: Rod Stewart

quote: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
author: Jim Carrey

quote: Adults are always asking children what they want to be when they grow up because they’re looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: A perfect parent is a person with excellent child-rearing theories and no actual children.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Just be good and kind to your children. Not only are they the future of the world, they’re the ones who can sign you into a home.
author: Dennis Miller

quote: When I was a kid my parents moved a lot, but I always found them.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: If you are not yelling at your kids, you are not spending enough time with them.
author: Reese Witherspoon

quote: When your mother asks, ‘Do you want a piece of advice?’ it is a mere formality. It doesn’t matter if you answer yes or no. You’re going to get it anyway.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Kids are expensive, I didn’t even realize how broke I was until last year someone stole my identity and it ruined her life.
author: Kate Davis

quote: I want my children to have all the things I couldn’t afford. Then I want to move in with them.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: It seems I have spent a lifetime of mouthing mechanically, ‘Say thank you. Sit up straight. Use your napkin. Close your mouth when you chew. Don’t lean back in your chair.’ Just when I finally got my husband squared away, the kids came along.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: There is no such thing as fun for the whole family.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: There are two classes of travelfirst class and with children.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: Happiness is having a large, caring, close-knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: When your children are teenagers, it’s important to have a dog so that someone in the house is happy to see you.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: A dog teaches a boy fidelity, perseverance, and to turn around three times before lying down.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: If dogs could talk, it would take a lot of fun out of owning one.
author: Andrew A. Rooney

quote: If you think dogs can’t count, try putting three dog biscuits in your pocket and then giving Fido only two of them.
author: Phil Pastoret

quote: The cat could very well be man’s best friend but would never stoop to admitting it.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Cats are smarter than dogs. You can’t get eight cats to pull a sled through snow.
author: Jeff Valdez

quote: In order to maintain a well­-balanced perspective, the person who has a dog to worship him should also have a cat to ignore him.
author: Peterborough Examiner, Canada

quote: Thousands of years ago, cats were worshipped as gods. Cats have never forgotten this.
author: Anonymous

quote: Friends are God’s way of apologizing to us for our families.
author: Anonymous

quote: The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four Americans is suffering from some form of mental illness. Think of your three best friends. If they’re okay, then it’s you.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: The holy passion of friendship is of so sweet and steady and loyal and enduring a nature that it will last through a whole lifetime, if not asked to lend money.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because they are generally the same people.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: If you can’t beat them, arrange to have them beaten.
author: George Carlin

quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, look at the people he gave it to.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Before borrowing money from a friend, decide which you need most.
author: Addison H. Hallock

quote: Never keep up with the Joneses. Drag them down to your level. It’s cheaper.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: People say money is not the key to happiness, but I have always figured if you have enough money, you can have a key made.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Anybody who tells you money can’t buy happiness never had any.
author: Samuel L. Jackson

quote: Misers are no fun to live with, but they make great ancestors.
author: Tom Snyder

quote: Anyone can do any amount of work, provided it isn’t the work he is supposed to be doing at that moment.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: I like work; it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: Doing nothing is very hard to do. You never know when you’re finished.
author: Leslie Nielsen

quote: Hard work never killed anybody, but why take a chance?
author: Edgar Bergen

quote: Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

quote: All I’ve ever wanted was an honest week’s pay for an honest day’s work.”   Sgt. Bilko.
author: Steve Martin

quote: A college education is one of the few things a person is willing to pay for and not get.
author: William Lowe Bryan

quote: In real life, I assure you, there is no such thing as algebra.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: You are only young once. After that you have to think up some other excuse.
author: Billy Arthur

quote: By the time you’re 80 years old you’ve learned everything. You only have to remember it.
author: George Burns

quote: You can’t believe everything you hear but you can repeat it.
author: Anonymous

quote: A gossip is a person who creates the smoke in which other people assume there's fire
author: Dan Bennett

quote: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If you can’t be kind, at least be vague.
author: Judith Martin

quote: It’s so much easier to suggest solutions when you don’t know too much about the problem.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Any fool can criticize, condemn and complain and most do.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: People can’t drive you crazy if you don’t give them the keys.
author: Mike Bechtle

quote: Sometimes you lie in bed at night and you don’t have a single thing to worry about. That always worries me!
author: Charlie Brown

quote: Keep your temper. Nobody else wants it.
author: Dearborn Independent

quote: If God did not intend for us to eat animals, then why did he make them out of meat?
author: John Cleese

quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
author: Miss Piggy

quote: When the waitress asked if I wanted my pizza cut into four or eight slices, I said, ‘Four. I don’t think I can eat eight.'
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Not all chemicals are bad. Without hydrogen and oxygen, for example, there would be no way to make water, a vital ingredient in beer.
author: Dave Barry

quote: I always cook with wine. Sometimes I even add it to the food.
author: W.C. Fields

quote: Always do sober what you said you’d do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: All the things I like to do are either immoral, illegal, or fattening.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: Health nuts are going to feel stupid someday, lying in hospitals dying of nothing.
author: Redd Fox

quote: Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It is useless to try to hold a person to anything he says while he’s madly in love, drunk, or running for office.
author: B. Birdsong

quote: The only time some fellows are ever seen with their wives is after they’ve been indicted.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn’t have declared their independence from it.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There’s no use being a damn fool about it.
author: W.C. Fields

quote: It is not enough to succeed. Others must fail.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Thankfully, perseverance is a great substitute for talent.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
author: Anonymous

quote: Whoever said money can’t buy happiness simply didn’t know where to go shopping.
author: Bo Derek

quote: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: A bore is the kind of man who, when you ask him how he is, he tells you.
author: Channing Pollock

quote: She never lets ideas interrupt the easy flow of her conversation.
author: Jean Webster

quote: He can compress the most words into the smallest idea of any man I know.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: By the time someone says, ‘To make a long story short,’ it’s too late.
author: Don Herold

quote: There but for the grace of God, goes God.
author: Anonymous

quote: He is a self-made man and worships his creator.
author: Henry Clapp

quote: The nice thing about egotists is that they don’t talk about other people.
author: Lucille S. Harper

quote: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: An optimist is someone who falls off the Empire State Building, and after 50 floors says, ‘So far so good!'
author: Anonymous

quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
author: George Will

quote: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.
author: James Branch Cabell

quote: I’m not offended by blonde jokes because I know I’m not dumb…and I also know that I’m not blonde.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: We use 10% of our brains. Imagine how much we could accomplish if we used the other 60%.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: My definition of an intellectual is someone who can listen to the William Tell Overture without thinking of the Lone Ranger.
author: Billy Connolly

quote: When it doubt, look intelligent.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I’m not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Think of how stupid the average person is and realize half of them are stupider than that.
author: George Carlin

quote: If stupidity got us into this mess, then why can’t it get us out?
author: Will Rogers

quote: According to most studies, people’s number one fear is public speaking. Number two is death. Death is number two. Does that seem right? That means to the average person, if you have to go to a funeral, you’re better off in the casket than doing the eulogy.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: I don’t believe in reincarnation, and I didn’t believe in it when I was a hamster.
author: Shane Richie

quote: Always go to other people’s funerals; otherwise they won’t come to yours.
author: Yogi Berra
